tripreview.Title: "A renowned temple close to cochin"
tripreview.sentence: This famous temple of Goddess Bhagavathy at chotanikara is close to cochin and a popular religious shrine in Kerala.
Thronged by devotees this temple is known for specific cures.
The temple has a historical legacy.
The Goddess here is worshipped in three forms.
Temple has facilities attached for stay of the devotees.
The area surrounding the temple requires better upkeep.
Ample parking is available around the temple.

tripreview.Title: "Realize the triade life cycles through the daily puja here."
tripreview.sentence: A place of worship, especially for Hindus.
Devotees of Lord Ayyappa, coming from other southern states of India has almost made it a routine to visit this temple.
One would pray to Saraswathy in the morning, Lakshmi at noon and Durga in the evening.

I am not too sure, if this signifies the learning in the childhood of the live of a human being, acquiring money, wealth in the mid life and the strength and Shakthi, solace in the fag end of the life, through three different forms of deity here, being worshiped.

tripreview.Title: "Chottanikkara Temple"
tripreview.sentence: One of the oldest Temples of Kerala, with art of architecture, different paintings all around the walls of temple, well attracted by locals, all festivals with many elephants and combinations of dances, drums, and other musical instruments, very famous temple.
It is about 20 kms away from Cochin.

tripreview.Title: "If you are a Hindu, this is a must-visit temple."
tripreview.sentence: I grew up visiting Chottanickara Temple.
I make it a point to visit this temple at least once a year, more if I can.
Most recently, I was there in Feb 2016.
If you are a Hindu and visiting Kochi Metro area, this is a destination not to be missed.

we reached by noon when they close the main part .

One who is suffering from any hurdles in day to day life, will be accomplished doing Darshan of Bhagavathi.
Particularly Friday night pooja to be performed.
Devasthanam accomodation is available for devotees who comes from distance.

tripreview.Title: "Goddess Bhagavathy:cure for mental illness"
tripreview.sentence: The Chottanikara temple is probably the most famous temple in Cochin - at least that is what I was told.
Another reason I was keen on visiting this temple was that it is renowned for 'curing' patients with mental illness.
Goddess Bhagavathy is a popular goddess in Kerala, and it being the auspicious day of Pongal - the temple was hugely crowded with long lines of devotees.
An interesting experience.

tripreview.Title: "Hotel Aaryas ' a warning"
tripreview.sentence: I went to "Aryas" chottanikkara on 17.01.16 after going to chottanikkara temple.
Ordered Masala Dosa.
I got the worst food ever.
The Dosa stuffed with Masala having rotten potatoes.
When I cited this to the counter and bearer, they paid no empathy to me.
When I told him that "I will show him" he waived his head "yes, please do".
Being a busy season hotel is full of Pilgrims, but how on earth they could exploit them on pretext that " the customer will never come".
Though I may never go there again, by I am no going to leave the too.
I seen their kitchen from the parking ground, where there is free access to kitchen.
All staff with dirty, unclean,black hands and some even scratch there body (under arm) while taking food.
I felt omitting.

tripreview.sentence: Devotees reach here with love for the goddess
None will go disappointed from here,all prayers answered

tripreview.sentence: Chottanikara , this small temple town is situated just an hour's drive away from Ernakulam .
Chottanikara temple is a old and famous temple in kerala.
Not only in kerala almost its famous in world .
The Divine Chottanikara Amma is worshipped in three different forms.
As Goddess Saraswathi in the morning , dressed in white : As Bhadrakali at noon with crimson red cloth : and As Durga in the evening with a sparkilng blue dress.
It is usually crowded in all time especially on Tuesdays and Fridays.

tripreview.Title: "Crowded Temple with a Powerful Goddess"
tripreview.sentence: A very powerful Devi Temple, usually very crowded.
The women can use the separate queue to save time.

tripreview.Title: "Bhagavathi Temple --Chotanikkara"
tripreview.sentence: The Chottanikkara temple is located at a distance of about 15 kms from Ernakulam in the State of Kerala.
This is a famous temple of the Hindu mother Goddess Bhagawati.

Bhagawati is one of the most popular deities in the area, this Chottanikkara Devi is worshipped at the temple, in three different forms: as Saraswati in the morning, draped in white; as Lakshmi at noon, draped in crimson; and as Durga in the evening, decked in blue.
The common visitors at this temple are those suffering from mental illnesses as they believe that Goddess Bhagawati is thought to cure Her devotees.
One more important ritual done at this temple is 'Guruthi Pooja' .
This ritual takes place at late evening to invoke the Goddess.
It is said that, earlier this was done only on Fridays, but nowadays, it is performed every day.
Though there are other Bhagavathi temples in Kerala, this Bhagavathi temple at Chotanikkara has gained importance because of the belief that mental illness can be cured here.

tripreview.Title: "Chottanikkara Durga Temple"
tripreview.sentence: Almost 18 kms away from Ernakulam city, on a hill is this prominent temple of Kerala.
It is well connected by public transportation.
The deity is worshipped as Saraswati in the morning Lakshmi at noon and as Durga in the evening.

tripreview.Title: "One of the Important Temples"
tripreview.sentence: Well maintained temple.
Crowded at times.
do not take flowers from outside for offering to the deity -- the temple authorities do not accept this.

tripreview.Title: "Jai Mata Di !!! "
tripreview.sentence: Blissful Brilliance !

tripreview.Title: "Divine"
tripreview.sentence: Chottanikkara bhagawathi kshethram is a famous temple in cochin.
November to January time is peak season because of sabarimala season.

tripreview.Title: "A great place of worship"
tripreview.sentence: Chottanikkara Bhagavathy temple is quite famous and attracts pilgrims from all over India.

In earlier years we have been regularly worshipping in this temple and the annual festival popularly known as Chottanikkara Makam is very famous and thousands of devotees come to the temple to seek blessings of the Devi.
Off late, due to heavy rush and long serpentine queue for darshan our visit to this temple has become less frequent.

tripreview.sentence: Visited at 5.00 am in the morning for Darshan from Kumarakom to Kochi, Never seen such a way Morning poojas were conducted with Elephants , Music and pilgrims doing Pradishnas.

tripreview.sentence: This temple is being renovated now.
This is a very nice temple and easily accessible from Cochin (17-18kms).
The temple opens at around 3:30AM (check timings during festival seasons).
Be prepared for some waiting in the queues as the sanctum is shut from time to time for pooja.
There is a temple Kizhakavu which is a 5min walk down this temple.
Do not miss that.
On the way up, you can visit the new Iyyappan shrine very next to this temple.
You can buy sacred threads, anklets in Chottanikara temple which is considered to drive away the evil.

tripreview.Title: "Famous"
tripreview.sentence: This is a famous temple where the devotees from all over Kerala and nearby states flood in to receive the blessings of the Deity in this temple.

tripreview.Title: "Renowned temple of Bhagavathy"
tripreview.sentence: I have been visiting this temple since my childhood.
Even now I make it a point to visit this temple every time I reach Kochi.
This Bhagavathi is known to be very powerful and scores of people have had wonderful experiences.
This forum is not appropriate for me to describe the history of the temple.
But what is amazing is the dedication with which rituals and pooja are conducted and how well preserved the traditions are.
It is important to visit the Keezhkaavu shrine close to the main temple of Bhagavathy.

tripreview.Title: "Powerful goddesses"

tripreview.Title: "Mr"

tripreview.sentence: Visits to temples is always a very personal and divine experience.
Chottanikkara Bhagavathy temple is 20 Kms from Ernakulam city centre.
According to legends the Devi here manifests herself as Saraswathy in the morning, Lakshmy in the afternoon and Durga in the evening.
With enormous amount of devotees thronging the temple regularly, there is indeed a positive vibration in the temple premises.
The temple is well kept and fairly large.
No specific dress code except that male devotees need to be bare chested while entering the sanctum sanctorum.

tripreview.sentence: It is a very well maintained orthodox temple.

Before going to temple you can call the temple as well to check on timings.

tripreview.sentence: This is among the most sacred temple in Kerala with the devi in three avatars - as Saraswathi, as Lakshmi and as Kali.
The grounds are large and one is assured usually of a good darshan.

tripreview.Title: "Bliss to Inner Consiousness"
tripreview.sentence: A very old temple in Kerala famous for the wooden sculpture.
Devi is worshipped in three forms.
As Saraswati in the morning, draped in white.
Lakshmi at noon, draped in crimson.
Durga in the evening, decked in blue.
People suffering from mental illnesses commonly visit the temple for remedy.
The crowd is huge on weekends.
So weekdays are the best option.

Better to avoid during rainy seasons.

Not a very good experience to see mentally sick people doing all types of rituals, but the place is known for this only.

tripreview.Title: "Nice temple"
tripreview.sentence: I visited this temple during working day and hence I was able to have darshan within 10-15 minutes.
The temple has a separate shrine for keezhakavu bagawathi along with a pond.
In case you are landing at Kochi airport this temple can be covered on the way to ernakulam / fort kochi (From Vytilla bus terminus).
Tripunithura palace museum is nearby the temple and can be reached by public transport from here.

tripreview.Title: "Must Visit Temple"
tripreview.sentence: One among popular temples of Kerala.
The Goddess is worshiped in 3 forms - Saraswathy in the morning, Lakshmi at noon and Durga in the evening.
You can witness heavy rush on Tuesday, Friday and on holidays.
Make sure of the temple timings before you make a visit.
Some time you have to stand in long serpentine queue before you could have a dharsan.
The temple is famous for curing mental illness.
Makom Thozhal is an important festival of the temple during Feb/Mar every year.
The temple is crowded with devotees during the Nov - Jan Sabarimala Pilgirmage season.

tripreview.Title: "Bhagavathi will bless you"
tripreview.sentence: Pray, Bhagavathi will give what ever u want.

tripreview.Title: "DEVI IN THREE FORMS"
tripreview.sentence: Bhagavathy temple of Chottanikkara is also called as Rajarajeshwari.
It is very old temple built in wood near Ernakulam.
She swayambhu devi in laterite.
She is worshipped in the form of Godess SARASWATHY in the morning, Godess LAKSHMI in the afternoon and as Godess DURGA in the evening.
The men should wear pants without shirt.
In the temple, sandle wood paste and flower are given to devotees wrapped in banana leaf.
One can purchase silver or gold locket of the Bhagavathy sold by temple management.
To carry home sealed container of Neypayasam is sold at Rs 60/- per piece.
One can buy Yanthra which is also sold by temple management available in two versions one for home and the other for business place.
Sacred thread with thayatha in different colours is available for sale.
The temple is open from 3.30am to 11.30am and from 5pm to 8.30pm.

tripreview.Title: "Must visit Devi Temple"
tripreview.sentence: We visited this temple while we were coming back from Thirumandan Kunnu Temple.

tripreview.Title: "Ammae Narayana, Devi Narayana."
tripreview.sentence: One of the finest temples in Kerala, this is a must visit place for all devotees of Goddess Adiparasakthi.
The temple is in two ground levels - Melkkavu (upper tier) and Kizhukkavu (lower tier).
In between these two levels we have temples for Ayyappa, Siva, Ganapathi, Nagas and other Devas.
The main deity, Goddess is worshipped as Saraswathy in the morning, Lakshmi at noon and Durga in the evening.
The Bhadrakaali at Kizhukkavu is believed to relieve evil spirit from devotees.

tripreview.Title: "Chottanikkara Bhagawathy Temple"
tripreview.sentence: The temple is located near Ernakulam in the southern Indian state of Kerala , 8 KM away from Thripunithara in Kochi city.
The major festival of this temple is in the month of Kumbam (February to march).
The goddess is supposed to come out of the temple and bless all and after her ritual bath (aarattu) return to the temple.
In the same month, on the Makham star day, between 2 PM to 5 PM, there is an observance of 'Makham thozhal' It is believed that if unmarried people do that ritual, they would get married soon.

tripreview.Title: "Must visit in any pilgrimage via Cochin"
tripreview.sentence: Good to visit the temple in the evening hours since rush will be less.
Well maintained with sufficient parking space.

tripreview.Title: "Mentally ill is cured here with blessings"
tripreview.sentence: The famous Chottanikkara Bhagavathy temple located in Ernakulam is one of the most revered Devi temple in Kerala.
People suffering from mental illness are supposed to be cured by this goddess.
The Devi here is worshipped as Saraswati in the morning, Lakshmi at noon and Durga in the evening.

tripreview.sentence: The place of Hindu worship mainly for ladies.

tripreview.Title: "Kochi an experience"
tripreview.sentence: Kochi itself is an exciting part of Kerala, different from other Southern states.
It is must to see the temples especially Aiyappa temples, as it is the most worshipped deity.
The back waters are over hyped unless your are into it.
It is an experience not much to write home about !
Food is different and Good.
Don't miss the fresh cooked fish at Kochi Fort and experience the Dancing and the Kerala massage.

tripreview.Title: "Bhagavathy temple"
tripreview.sentence: we went this temple early hours and got darshan, some special puja, archana performed, peaceful place.

tripreview.Title: "powerful goddess temple"
tripreview.sentence: Devi Temple is one among the most famous temples of Kerala where mentally disturbed people, come in thousands to get cured.
This temple is 8 KM away from present-day Thripoonithura (cochin).
There are two main temples here.
The first one we see as soon as we enter is the temple of Rajarajeswari.
The one behind it in a slightly lower elevation is called Keezhekavu, which has Bhadra Kali consecrated there.
The Rajarajeswari is worshipped as Goddess Saraswathi in the morning, as Bhadra kali at noon and Durga in the night.

tripreview.Title: "Get Blessings from Mother Goddess"
tripreview.sentence: Total Devotion
No Arguments.
Visit if you Believe
Dhoti or Long Pants allowed, need to remove shirts and banyan

tripreview.Title: "Mother Goddess...."
tripreview.sentence: Located around 20km from Kochi city, Chottanikkara is a very famous and vital Hindu temple in Southern part of the country.
Famed as one of the most powerful Goddess, comprises of two temples - Melkkavu (temple located up) and Keezhkkavu (temple located down).
The temple is believed to be a place to relieve people who are mentally disturbed.
You may see a lot of people roaming inside temple chanting but they may seem to be distributed.
People believe that staying there and worshipping for around 12 days will relieve you from all mental tensions.
Another belief is that if kids are made to wear the sand inside the temple premises, they won't have fears during childhood.

tripreview.Title: "Chottanikkara Bhagavathi Temple Hstory and Significance"
tripreview.sentence: Chottanikkara Temple is one among the most famous temples of Kerala where mentally disturbed people, come in thousands to get cured.
This temple is 8 KM away from present-day Thripoonithura (which is a suburb of Kochin or Eranakulam).
There are two main temples here.
The first one we see as soon as we enter is the temple of Rajarajeswari.
The one behind it in a slightly lower elevation is called Keezhekavu, which has Bhadra Kali consecrated there.
The Rajarajeswari is worshipped as Goddess Saraswathi in the morning, as Bhadra kali at noon and Durga in the night.
This temple opens its doors every day at 4 AM.
People believe that Goddess Mookambika of Kollur attends the first worship here before going to her temple.
Another peculiarity of this temple is that the Goddess is not fixed to the ground but rests on a bed of sand.
Nearby her, is the idol of Lord Vishnu.
Hence the devotees always pray to her along with her brother Lord Narayana and chant 'Amme Narayana'.
The 'sthala purana' of this temple tells that once the place this temple is located was a dense forest.
It is felt that if a mentally disturbed person participates and witnesses this Guruthi daily, the evil spirit which has affected them would leave them and run away.
There is also a huge pala tree, in which these people as part of a traditional ritual drive huge nails by knocking them with their foreheads.
The weak hearted are advised to keep away from the Keezhe Kavu Bhagawathi temple least they are scared for life.
There are also temples of Lord Shiva, Ganapathi and Naga in this temple.
The major festival of this temple is in the month of Kumbam (February to march).
The goddess is supposed to come out of the temple and bless all and after her ritual bath (aarattu) return to the temple.

In the same month, on the Makham star day, between 2 PM to 5 PM, there is an observance of 'Makham thozhal' It is believed that if unmarried people do that ritual, they would get married soon and if married people does that their marital harmony would improve.

tripreview.Title: "Powerful Goddess Devi"
tripreview.sentence: Located at Eranakulam ,this Devi temple is a very poweful goddess who fulfills the wishes of her devout devotees .
Not so crowded temple and well maintained.

tripreview.Title: "Chottanikkara Bhagavathy Temple"
tripreview.sentence: The temple is quite and calm and we were able to have good darshan.
it is advisable to wear dhoti or full pants.
Bermudas are not permitted.
Banians are to be removed while entering sanctum sanctorum.
There is an option to offer by Vedi for prarthanas .
We enjoyed the visit to the temple and staff were kind.

tripreview.Title: "Center of tranquility and power"
tripreview.sentence: The aura of peace is impregnable in this ancient temple and its surroundings.
They have a unique offering done with crackers named Vedivazhipadu.
The Rakhtapushpanjali offering done for the fulfilment of desires and recovery from ills gotten from evil is well known.
Many people live within the temple premises and perform austerities for long periods.
I am like all visitors, left feeling deep peace and fulfilment after visiting this sacred place.

tripreview.Title: "Chotanikkara Baghavathi Temple."
tripreview.sentence: The Chottanikkara is a famous temple of the Hindu mother goddess Bhagawati.

The temple is located near Ernakulam in the southern Indian state of Kerala and is one of the most popular temples in the state and in terms of temple architecture,this temple stands out to be an ultimate testmonial for the ancient vishwakarma sthapathis (wooden sculpture) in sculpting this temple along with Sabarimala.

Bhagawati is one of the most popular deities in the area, Chottanikkara Devi is worshipped at the temple, in three different forms: as Saraswati in the morning, draped in white; as Lakshmi at noon, draped in crimson; and as Durga in the evening, decked in blue.
Lord Shiva is also worshiped at the temple.
